e4: Changing to the new policy eliminates the risk of legal liability and maintains ethical standards in financial reporting. By providing unbiased earnings, ABC Company can enhance transparency and build trust with investors. While some may initially misunderstand the new policy, in the long run, it promotes a more accurate portrayal of the company’s performance, protecting both retail and institutional investors. This integrity can lead to a more stable investor base and mitigate potential fallout from regulatory scrutiny.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty. It should provide investors with a clear and honest representation of the company’s financial performance without manipulation. Consideration should also be given to how changes in reporting impact different types of investors, especially retail investors who may lack sophisticated understanding. Ethical reporting should aim to build trust, support fair market practices, and comply with regulatory standards, ultimately fostering long-term stability and integrity in the investment community.
e6: Yes, I would like to know how the management plans to communicate the changes to the new policy to both institutional and retail investors, ensuring they understand the implications. Additionally, I would ask what strategies will be put in place to manage investor expectations and mitigate any potential backlash from the transition.
